wikipedia_page.main: Stuart Olof Agrell (5 March 1913 – 29 January 1996) was an optical mineralogist and collaborator applying the electron microprobe to petrology. His involvement in the Apollo program brought him to the attention of the British media and public. He was also interested in moon rocks and the moon itself.

response: * Optical mineralogist Stuart Olof Agrell (1913–1996) was born in Ruislip.

Agrellite (NaCa2Si4O10F) is a mineral found in Quebec, Canada and a few other locations. IThe IMA symbol is Are. Agrellite displays pink fluorescence under both shortwave and longwave ultraviolet light.Handbook of Mineralogy It is named in honour of Stuart Olof Agrell (1913–1996).first reported in the Canadian Mineralogist (1976), vol. 14, pp. 120-126

It was first described in 1960 by Stuart Olof Agrell in the Laytonville quarry, Mendocino County, California.  Zussmanite is named in honor of Jack Zussman (born 1924), Head of the University of Manchester’s Department of Geology and co-author of Rock-Forming Minerals.
*Stuart Olof Agrell, English geologist and mineralogist (b. 1913)

response: * Stuart Olof Agrell (1913–1996), optical mineralogist renowned for his involvement in the Apollo programme, was born in Ruislip.
